cleaned_text: Stay up-to-date on Virginia COVID-19 trends, vaccination data, and more. VDH's up-to-date COVID-19 resources for health professionals in Virginia. COVID-19 vaccines are available to everyone aged 6 months and older. Symptoms typically appear 2-14 days after exposure to the virus. People with COVID-19 might not have any [symptoms](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/symptoms.html). If they do, their symptoms can range from mild to severe. Regardless of your vaccination status or if you've already had COVID-19, there are things you can do if you were exposed to COVID-19. COVID-19 treatments can help prevent severe illness in [people with certain medical conditions](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/people-with-medical-conditions.html) when taken as soon as possible after symptoms start. Learn about your treatment options if you are at high risk for developing severe disease [ [Español](https://espanol.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/people-with-medical-conditions.html)]. Guidance for certain settings including for businesses, congregate settings, and schools [is available](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/coronavirus/get-the-latest-guidance/).
